activities:
We have made changes to our privacy policy in response to the recent decision by the European Court of Justice that the Safe Harbor Framework is no longer a valid mechanism for transferring the Personal Data of EU citizens from the European Economic Area (EEA) to the United States or any other country deemed not to provide an adequate level of security for such data. Auth0® will use Model Contract Clauses (processor) approved by the European Commission in connection with such transfers. Please see our Terms of Service (at http://auth0.com/terms) and our Model Contract Clauses (at http://auth0.com/mcc) for more information. Auth0® will also continue to abide by the Safe Harbor Framework, and adhere to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles of notice, choice, onward transfer, security, data integrity, access and enforcement.

In compliance with the US-EU and US-Swiss Safe Harbor Principles, Auth0® commits to resolve complaints about your privacy and our collection or use of your personal information.  European Union or Swiss citizens with inquiries or complaints regarding this privacy policy should first contact Auth0® at support@auth0.com.

Auth0® has further committed to refer unresolved privacy complaints under the US-EU and US-Swiss Safe Harbor Principles to an independent dispute resolution mechanism, the BBB EU SAFE HARBOR, operated by the Council of Better Business Bureaus. If you do not receive timely acknowledgment of your complaint, or if your complaint is not satisfactorily addressed by Auth0®, please visit the BBB EU SAFE HARBOR web site at www.bbb.org/us/safe-harbor-complaints for more information and to file a complaint.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Usage information and Personal information voluntarily provided to us. This does not include manually processed data.
